ygData.subject: RE: [EverQuest] EQIM: EverQuest Instant Messaging
ygData.msgSnippet: My opinion ( and I know just like my ass I got one hehe.) I think charging is not a problem. They are giving you access to all servers to see what s going
ygData.messageBody:
My opinion ( and I know just like my ass I got one hehe.) I think charging is not a problem. They are giving you access to all servers to "see" what's going on. The potential for this is great, as they said set up a raid at work monitr activities ( get that buddy of yours who doesn't work to farm some equip. for you when no one is on ) and so on and so on. The way I figure it if you don't want to pay don't get it ( also if you are someone who doesn't see a need for it i.e. Me ) if you don't mind paying for it get it. You must realize that you pay for server access with the game and this is going to give you  access albiet limited but still access. So if the cost is $10-$12 it will be way too much but $4.99 who knows?

Freelight Solguard

46 Pally

Tribunal

 alexander.jones@... wrote:

What attitude?
 
You bought a product, end of story. They fix bugs in it, albeit slowly. That you acn whine about. Why the hell do you argue about free content? When you buy a car, do you think that after a year youve had it that the salesman will phone you up and say hey - we got this cool new cdplayer, come here and we will install it for free cause you bought a car last year? Are you from the planet mars?
 
This purchase was done long ago, just give it a rest.
 
As for PoP, the cost of pop is nothing compared to what you get if you like to play. Transportation system alone will make the game more enjoyable. It costs like 2 months of playtime which would be less than the amount you spend going out for a dinner ONE evening. You seem to have a miserable life and think Sony is to blame for it.
 
over and out
 
 
-----Original Message-----
From: Orion [mailto:orionv@...]
Sent: den 3 november 2002 14:30
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] EQIM: EverQuest Instant Messaging

Jaggedpine was months ago and yes to all the rest but what have they done for us lately. They led everyone to believe that all the /raid stuff would be free then bam you have to buy POP to get it. New bought spells in POP are Nodrop,etc.. Getting really tired of Verants attitude.
 
----- Original Message -----
From: Matthew Bond
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, November 03, 2002 12:46 AM
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] EQIM: EverQuest Instant Messaging

Orion wrote:
> It is a good concept but I am not willing to pay for it. Verant
> doesn't give anything away anymore. No new zones,no raid channel
> nothing.

They do give us new zones for free occasionally... Jaggedpine Forest was
a free download on the optional patch only a few months ago. About a
year ago there was The Warrens and Stonebrunt Mountains, and before that
we had Paineel and The Hole.

Honig Wayfarer
54 Ranger
Cazic Thule
